data.text:
This reproduces the numbered list originally found on Discogs (complete with who submitted the albums plus notes), since Discogs has decided to break their list function. The numbering refers to order of submission, with albums that didn’t have a Discogs entry being numbered as “0[letter]”. If you want to attempt accessing the list on Discogs, it’s here (I recommend the app over the website).

As with the alphabetized list, an asterisk (*) beside an album title indicates that it also appears in the 1001 Albums You Must Hear Before You Die book. The links for each album will take you to the album’s master release page on Discogs (or, if not on Discogs, to Bandcamp or another relevant link). And when we’ve done a blog feature on the album, the band/title name will be bolded and a link to that post will be added. If the Mastodon user requested that their instance be included, their user name is clickable and will take you to their Mastodon profile.

The Index catalogues all the albums in The List by artist (especially helpful for albums such as compilations where the artists aren’t listed in the title), country/place/peoples, contributor, release year, and release decade.
